1.brief: a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
Jeshajah, the name of seven Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Uzzijah, the name of five Israelites
Jotham, the name of three Israelites
Achaz, the name of a Jewish king and of an Israelite
Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel

3.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
a male ass (from its dun red)
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
